intro: Geijera, commonly known as the native wattle, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. Geijera species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
